result.execSummary:
The defendant Erika D Conner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Erika D Conner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Erika D Conner was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Erika D Conner was found guilty of Intent. Use Oleoresin Device-Bodily Harm, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.26(4)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with the victim, her family, her residence or place of employment.
Not to possess any pepper spray.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation in Count 2 of this.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County and allow any conditions to allow tranfer.
Defendant to report to the huber facility by 06:00 p.m. on 09-21-2015.
AMENDED 09-28-2015:  Apply 1 days sentence credit.

filed by Attorney Martinez requesting 1 day credit; State has no objection to the 1 day sentence credit.
Recieved and filed in court by the State.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Erika D Conner in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  

State will move to dismiss Count 1.
Defense has no objections.
Court Grants - Count 1 is dismissed.

Matter will proceed to Sentencing on counts 2 & 3.
State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Victim presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 2:  
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 Year.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim, her family, residence or place of employment.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Not to possess any pepper spray.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.





Count 3:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County and allow any conditions to allow transfer.
Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 6:00 pm. on:  09/21/15.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation on count 2.
Sentencing hearing on September 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
(3) Notes sent out by Jurors.

Day Two
Continued from:  08/11/15
Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Erika D Conner in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez and attorney Dan McMurray.

Court on the record at 8:45 p.m.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 8:55 a.m.

State presented closing arguments.
Defense presented closing arguments.
State presented rebuttal.
Court read the Jury Instruction and Verdicts to the Jurors.
Bailiff sworn in @ 9:52 a.m.
Jurors excused for deliberations @ 9:52 a.m.

Court addressed with the parties what exhibits would be allowed back with the jurors if requested.
Court in adjournment pending verdict.

Jurors sent out a note @ 10:38 a.m.
Court back on the record @ 10:52 a.m.
Court addressed the Note sent out by the jurors with the parties.
Response given back to the jurors.
Jurors are requesting testimony be read back.
Court in adjournment @ 10:58 a.m.

Court back on the record @ 12:11 p.m.
Juror returned to the courtroom @  12:14 p.m.
Court reporter Barb Dassow re-read the defendant's testimony to the jurors.
Jurors return to deliberate at 12:39 p.m.
Court in recess at 12:39 p.m.


Jurors sent out another note.
Court back on the record @ 1:55 p.m.
Juors returned to the courtroom @ 2:01 p.m.
Court addressed with the Jurors that they have come to decision/verdict as to counts 2 & 3, however, they are deadlocked on count 1.
Court read and receives the verdicts on Count 2 - GUILTY and Count 3 GUILTY.
State moves for judgment on counts 2 & 3.
Court enters judgment on counts 2 & 3.
As to Count 1 - Court declares a mistrial.
Court thanked the jurors.
Jurors excused @ 2:05 p.m.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Exhibits 1 - 10 from Jury Trial Held on 08/11/15 - 08/12/15 - Scanned.

Exhibit List from Jury Trial Held on 08/11/15 - 08/12/15.

Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  
Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.
Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges Form.
Voir Dire List and Random Voir Dire List.

Day One
Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Erika D Conner in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez and attorney Dan McMurray.

Court addressed Motions in Limine with the parties.
Court addressed courtroom procedures with the parties.

JAR called @ 8:58 a.m.
35 Potential Jurors Sent Up @ 9:22 a.m.
All potential jurors sworn in.
Clerk calls the first 20 names.

Court addressed all potential jurors.
Court conducts voir dire.
State conducts voir dire.
Defense conducts voir dire.
Court and parties went into the jury room for individual voir of one juror.

Parties conducted their strikes.
Clerk read the names of the 12 selected jurors.
Clerk swears in the 12 selected jurors.
Jurors not selected returned to the JAR.

Court back on the record @ 11:09 a.m.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 11:14 a.m.

State presented Opening Statements.
Defense presented Opening Statements.

Witness Called:  T.J. (Victim).
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Jurors excused for lunch @ 12:28 p.m.
Court in adjournment for lunch @ 12:30 p.m.

Court back on the record @ 1:53 p.m.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 1:54 p.m.

Witness Called:  Officer Katie Beres (City of Brookfield Police Department).
Witness Sworn and Testified.

State Rests.

Jurors excused from the courtroom @ 2:19 p.m.
Defense moves the court to dismiss count 3 and presented arguments.
State presented arguments.
Court Denies the Defense Request to dismiss count 3.
Court finds there is a prima facia showing.
Reasons placed on the record.

Court addressed the defendant's right to testify or not testify.
Court satisfied the defendant is fully aware of her rights to testify or not testify.

Exhibits Marked:  1 - 10.
Exhibits 1 - 10 have all been offered and received.

Witnesses Called:  S.J. (Witness) and Erika Conner (Defendant).
Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Testimony is deemed closed.
Jurors excused for a break @ 3:38 p.m.

State and Defense received a copy of the propsed jury instructions and verdicts for review.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 4:02 p.m.
Jurors excused for the evening @ 4:04 p.m.

Court addressed the Jury Instructions and Verdicts with the parties.
Defense requests instruction 772 be included and Self-Defense be included in count 3 and presented arguments.
State objects to both requests and presented arguments.
Response and replies presented.
Court Denies - Request to include instruction 772.
Reasons placed on the record.
Court Grants - Request for Self-Defense to be included in count 3.

Matter continued to 08/12/15 for Closing Arguments, Jury Instructions and Deliberations.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Erika D Conner in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  

Matter will proceed to Trial on Tuesday, 08/11/15.

Atty. Martinez presented arguments regarding his Motions in Limine filed back on 01/13/14 (stating counts 2 & 3 are duplicitous).
State presented arguments to the court.
Defense presented response.

Court Denies - Defense Motion in Limine.
Charges are not duplicitous.
Reasons placed on the record.
Jury status hearing on August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Erika D Conner in court with attorney Nicholas K. Martinez.  
Motion filed by Defense - To Admit Other Acts Evidence (Regarding two of the State's Witnesses).


Atty. Martinez presented arguments to the court.
State objects and presented arguments to the court.
Atty. Martinez presented response.

Court finds/orders the following:   Reasons placed on the record.
Court doesn't view this as an Other Acts Evidence issue.
Court views this as exploring the relationship between the Defendant and Witnesses.
Court finds the nature of the relationship between the Defendant and the witnesses is an appropriate area of inquiry.
Court doesn't specifically grant or deny the motion.

Matter to be set for Jury Trial.
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
